Title: Multiple vulnerabilities in sysstat
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities in the way sysstat handles symlinks may allow an
    attacker to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files

Background.Text: sysstat is a package containing a number of performance monitoring utilities for Linux, including sar, mpstat, iostat and sa tools

Description.Text:
There are two vulnerabilities in the way sysstat handles symlinks:

  1. The isag utility, which displays sysstat data in a graphical format, creates a temporary file in an insecure manner.
  2. Two scripts in the sysstat package, post and trigger, create temporary files in an insecure manner.

Impact.Text: Both vulnerabilities may allow an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files under the permissions of the user executing any of the affected utilities.

Workaround.Text: A workaround is not currently known for this issue. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of the affected package.
